Type.Name: BadImageFormatException
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when an attempt is made to load a from a file with an invalid file image.

remarks.para: This exception is thrown when the file image of an executable program is invalid. For example, this exception is thrown when unmanaged code is passed to for loading.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an attempt to load an unmanaged executable, which causes the system to throw a exception. The name of the unmanaged executable is "calc".

c.para: Caught: The format of the file 'calc' is invalid.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Format of the executable or library is invalid." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The and the properties of the new instance are initialized to .

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message)

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance using . If is , the property is initialized to the system-supplied message provided by the constructor that takes no arguments.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance using and the property using . If is , the property is initialized to the system-supplied message provided by the constructor that takes no arguments.
The property of the new instance is initialized to .
If the parameter is , the property is set to , the property does not contain the name of the file, and the method does not return the name of the file with the invalid image.

summary.para: Gets the name of the file with the invalid image.

value.para: A containing the name of the file with the invalid image, or if no file name was passed to the constructor for the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
.property string Message { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_Message() }

summary.para: Gets a that describes the error that caused the current exception.

remarks.para: If no message was supplied to the constructor for the current exception, this property returns a system-supplied error message. If the property is not , the message includes the file name.

summary.para: Returns a representation of the value of the current exception.

returns.para: A representation of the current exception.

remarks.para:
The string representation returned by this method includes the name of the exception, the value of the property, the result of calling on the inner exception, the value of the
property, and the result of calling . If any of these members is , its value is not included in the returned string.
